enWisdom: Doing good [to others] is beneficial
Benevolence is a treasure
Benevolence is the alms-tax for blessings
Benevolent acts are the best booty
Benevolence is the most honourable authority
Righteousness is the prize of the judicious
The intelligent person is one who spreads his generosity
Benevolence is the most thriving cultivation and the best treasure
Nobleness is the result of lofty endeavour [and high resolve]

Wisdom: الْمَعْرُوفُ كَنْزٌ فَانْظُرْ عِنْدَ مَنْ تُوَدِّعُهُ
enWisdom: Benevolence is a treasure so consider whom you are leaving it with
Benevolence is the better of the two treasures

Wisdom: الْإِحْسَانُ غَرِيزَةُ الْأَخْيَارِ وَالْإِسَاءَةُ غَرِيزَةُ الْأَشْرَارِ
enWisdom: Doing good is the nature of the righteous and doing evil is the nature of the wicked

Wisdom: الصَّنِيعَةُ إِذَا لَمْ تُرَبَّ أَخْلَقَتْ كَالثَّوْبِ الْبَالِي وَالْأَبْنِيَةِ الْمُتَدَاعِيَةِ
enWisdom: If a righteous act is not nurtured, it wears away, just like worn out garments and dilapidated buildings

Wisdom: افْعَلِ الْمَعْرُوفَ مَا أَمْكَنَ وَازْجُرِ الْمُسِي‏ءَ بِفِعْلِ الْمُحْسِنِ
enWisdom: Do good whenever possible, and deter the evildoer with righteous action

Wisdom: اغْتَنِمْ صَنَائِعَ الْإِحْسَانِ وَارْعَ ذِمَمَ الْإِخْوَانِ
enWisdom: Seize the opportunity to perform righteous deeds and be careful of your obligations towards your brothers

Wisdom: ابْذُلْ مَعْرُوفَكَ لِلنَّاسِ كَافَّةً فَإِنَّ فَضِيلَةَ فِعْلِ الْمَعْرُوفِ لَا يَعْدِلُهَا عِنْدَ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ شَيْ‏ءٌ
enWisdom: Extend your benevolence to all the people, for verily nothing can be equated with the virtue of a good turn in the sight of Allah, the Glorified
Give generously when you are asked
The best faith is [that which is accompanied by] righteousness
NULL
The most profitable wares are the rendering of benevolent actions
The best good deed is coming to the aid of the aggrieved
The merit of a righteous action is better than the action [itself]
The best honour is doing good to others
The most beautiful act of a person in a position of power is conferring of favours [to those under him]

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ الشَّرَفِ كَفُّ الْأَذَى وَبَذْلُ الْإِحْسَانِ
enWisdom: The best honour is desisting from harming others and doing good to others

Wisdom: إِنَّ مَكْرُمَةً صَنَعْتَهَا إِلَى أَحَدٍ مِنَ النَّاسِ إِنَّمَا أَكْرَمْتَ بِهَا نَفْسَكَ وَزَيَّنْتَ بِهَا عِرْضَكَ‏ فَلَا تَطْلُبْ مِنْ غَيْرِكَ شُكْرَ مَا صَنَعْتَ إِلَى نَفْسِكَ
enWisdom: Verily the good turn that you did to one of the people was only a means to ennoble yourself and embellish your honour, so do not seek gratitude from others for that which you did for yourself

Wisdom: إِنَّكُمْ إِلَى اصْطِنَاعِ الرِّجَالِ أَحْوَجُ مِنْكُمْ إِلَى جَمْعِ الْأَمْوَالِ
enWisdom: Verily you are more in need of doing good to the people than of accumulating wealth

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا الْكَرَمُ بَذْلُ الرَّغَائِبِ وَإِسْعَافُ الطَّالِبِ
enWisdom: Munificence is nothing but granting the wishes and fulfilling the needs of the seeker
When a good turn has been done to you then publicize it

Wisdom: إِذَا أَحْسَنْتَ عَلَى اللَّئِيمِ وَتَرَكَ بِإِحْسَانِكَ إِلَيْهِ
enWisdom: If you do good to a vile person, he will wrong you in return for your goodness to him

Wisdom: ثَلَاثٌ هُنَّ جِمَاعُ الْخَيْرِ إِسْدَاءُ النِّعَمِ وَرِعَايَةُ الذِّمَمِ وَصِلَةُ الرَّحِمِ
enWisdom: Three things consolidate that which is good: bestowing favours, guarding [one’s] sureties and keeping ties with near relatives
The beauty of a benevolent act is in completing it

Wisdom: خَيْرُ الْعِبَادِ مَنْ إِذَا أَحْسَنَ اسْتَبْشَرَ وَإِذَا أَسَاءَ اسْتَغْفَرَ
enWisdom: The best of servants is one who is delighted when he does good and when he does evil, he repents

Wisdom: خُذْ عَلَى عَدُوِّكَ بِالْفَضْلِ فَإِنَّهُ أَحَدُ الظَّفَرَيْنِ
enWisdom: Act with kindness towards your enemy for this is one of the two triumphs

Wisdom: خُذْ بِالْعَدْلِ وَأَعْطِ بِالْفَضْلِ تَحُزِ الْمَنْقَبَتَيْنِ
enWisdom: Take with justice but give with munificence; you will possess two virtues

Wisdom: ذُو الْعَقْلِ لَا يَنْكَشِفُ إِلَّا عَنِ احْتِمَالٍ وَإِجْمَالٍ وَإِفْضَالٍ
enWisdom: The one who possesses intellect is not known except by [his] tolerance, temperance and kindness
The pinnacle of faith is doing good to people
The alms-tax of wealth is benefitting others [with it]
The alms-tax of blessings is doing good to others
The embellishment of Islam is performing righteous actions

Wisdom: شَيْئَانِ لَا يُوَازِنُهُمَا عَمَلٌ حُسْنُ الْوَرَعِ وَالْإِحْسَانُ إِلَى الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
enWisdom: Two things cannot be matched in weight by any [other] action: virtuous piety and kindness towards the believers

Wisdom: صِدْقُ الْإِيمَانِ وَصَنَائِعُ الْإِحْسَانِ أَفْضَلُ الذَّخَائِرِ
enWisdom: True faith and good deeds are the best provisions
Doing good turns is from the merits of the human being
Counter the wrongs [of others] by doing good [to them]

Wisdom: عَلَيْكَ بِالْإِحْسَانِ فَإِنَّهُ أَفْضَلُ زِرَاعَةٍ وَأَرْبَحُ بِضَاعَةٍ
enWisdom: Espouse kindness, for it is the best cultivation and the most profitable merchandise
In every [act of] benevolence there is kindness
The worth of every person is [measured by] that which he does well
A person’s worth is based on the extent of his merit
Every [form of] benevolence is a favour

Wisdom: لِلْكِرَامِ فَضِيلَةُ الْمُبَادَرَةِ إِلَى فِعْلِ الْمَعْرُوفِ وَإِسْدَاءِ الصَّنَائِعِ
enWisdom: The merit of initiating good deeds and performing generous acts belongs to the noble-minded people

Wisdom: لَيْسَ ثَوَابٌ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ أَعْظَمَ مِنْ ثَوَابِ السُّلْطَانِ الْعَادِلِ وَالرَّجُلِ الْمُحْسِنِ
enWisdom: There is no reward with Allah, the Glorified, greater than the reward of a just ruler and a benevolent man

Wisdom: لَوْ رَأَيْتُمُ الْإِحْسَانَ شَخْصاً لَرَأَيْتُمُوهُ شَكْلًا جَمِيلًا يَفُوقُ الْعَالَمِينَ
enWisdom: If you were to see benevolence in the form a person, you would surely see him as a beautiful form that surpasses the worlds [in its beauty]
Whoever is granted success does good [work]
One who bestows favours fulfils the right of authority

Wisdom: مَنْ قَضَى مَا أُسْلِفَ مِنَ الْإِحْسَانِ فَهُوَ كَامِلُ الْحُرِّيَّةِ
enWisdom: One who fulfils the [debt of] goodness that was done to him in the past has attained true freedom

Wisdom: مَنِ انْتَجَعَكَ مُؤَمِّلًا فَقَدْ أَسْلَفَكَ حُسْنَ الظَّنِّ بِكَ فَلَا تُخَيِّبْ ظَنَّهُ
enWisdom: One who turns to you hopefully has already got a good impression of you, so do not disappoint his expectation

Wisdom: مَنْ قَبِلَ مَعْرُوفَكَ فَقَدْ أَوْجَبَ عَلَيْكَ حَقَّهُ
enWisdom: One who accepts your good turn has made his right over you mandatory [on himself]

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يُؤَكِّدْ قَدِيمَهُ بِحَدِيثِهِ شَانَ سَلَفَهُ وَخَانَ خَلَفَهُ
enWisdom: One who does not affirm his past [iethe good character of his forefathers] with his present [iehis own good character], disgraces his predecessor and betrays his successor
Doing good to others is part of an honourable purpose
One of the signs of turning [towards Allah] is doing good to the people

Wisdom: مَا تَوَسَّلَ أَحَدٌ إِلَيَّ بِوَسِيلَةٍ أَجَلَّ عِنْدِي مِنْ يَدٍ سَبَقَتْ مِنِّي إِلَيْهِ لِأُرَبِّيَهَا عِنْدَهُ بِاتِّبَاعِهَا أُخْتَهَا فَإِنَّ مَنْعَ الْأَوَاخِرِ يَقْطَعُ شُكْرَ الْأَوَائِلِ
enWisdom: No one has appealed to me with an intercession that is greater in my sight than a favour that I had previously done to him, so that I may nurture it and follow it up with another [favour] like it; for indeed later refusals cut off the gratitude for earlier favours

Wisdom: مِلَاكُ الْمُرُوَّةِ صِدْقُ اللِّسَانِ وَبَذْلُ الْإِحْسَانِ
enWisdom: The basis of magnanimity is truthful speech and doing good to others
What an excellent person the compassionate one is!

Wisdom: لَا يَكُونَنَّ أَخُوكَ عَلَى الْإِسَاءَةِ إِلَيْكَ أَقْوَى مِنْكَ عَلَى الْإِحْسَانِ إِلَيْهِ
enWisdom: Let not your brother be stronger in his iniquity towards you than you are in your goodness [towards him]
The consequences of kindness are never dispraised

Wisdom: يُسْتَدَلُّ عَلَى مُرُوَّةِ الرَّجُلِ بِبَثِّ الْمَعْرُوفِ وَبَذْلِ الْإِحْسَانِ وَتَرْكِ الِامْتِنَانِ
enWisdom: The magnanimity of a person is evinced by [his] spreading goodness, granting favours and abandoning [putting others under] obligation
